column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Think out of the Box and Find Alternative Solutions
#Text=Every now and then , someone will tell you to start thinking outside the box .
#Text=You instantly realize they are calling your ideas stale or redundant .
#Text=But what exactly is this box and how do you think outside of it ?
#Text=Well , here are a few pointers .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Figure out the problem you are trying to solve .
#Text=It helps if you know what you want to accomplish .
#Text=Think of all the solutions you can .
#Text=Anything you think of , write it down ; preferably on separate sheets of paper .
#Text=Look at your current solutions .
#Text=Take them to other people and ask for their opinions .
#Text=Listen to them and keep notes .
#Text=Go back through all of your solutions .
#Text=See if you can improve them with the opinions you received .
#Text=Now grab a blender ...
#Text=well , actually , grab anything you have near you .
#Text=Think about this item in terms of how it could help you solve your problem .
#Text=Maybe the item as a whole cannot help , but one specific part can .
#Text=Take notes on your current solutions if something you think of may help that solution be better .
#Text=READ .
#Text=Read everything you can on the topic of your problem , preferably from websites .
#Text=Look for strange ways of doing things and keep them in mind .
#Text=Take notes on your current solutions if something you read may help that solution be better .
#Text=Invent something that does not ( or cannot ) exist .
#Text=Make up an item which solves your problem .
#Text=Think about how this item works .
#Text=Maybe it uses principles from your current solutions , the opinions you 've received , the objects you 've looked at , and the articles or books you 've read or videos you 've watched .
#Text=Put it all together .
#Text=You want to think outside the box , but you still need to be organized .
#Text=Solutions happen when everything comes together .
#Text=Tips
#Text=Think like a Science Fiction writer .
#Text=Make something up and let the scientists explain how it works .
#Text=Just make sure it can actually work that way in the real world .
#Text=Do n't be afraid to enlist the help of others .
#Text=Brainstorming with other people is one of the best ways to think outside of the box .
#Text=Often , no matter how creative you are , someone else will have thought about something you would have never thought .
#Text=KISS .
#Text=No , not the band .
#Text=It 's an acronym which stand for Keep It Simple , Stupid .
#Text=Do n't make things too hard on yourself , nor on the people who will use your solution .
#Text=Keep notes .
#Text=These notes may help you with other tasks later on .
#Text=If all else fails pretend nothing exists to even help you obtain your goal .
#Text=You have to invent everything .
#Text=If nothing else , this will help you relax as you realize there 's already solutions to parts of your problem .
#Text=Warnings
#Text=Don ' steal other people 's work .
#Text=You 'll likely get sued and labeled as a fraud .
#Text=Make sure you do n't violate a confidentiality agreement by sharing ideas with the wrong person .
#Text=You could get fired .
#Text=Make sure you share with a trusted friend ( as long as the above does not apply ) who you know will not steal your ideas .
